description: With many women of color considering exiting the workforce due to unfair conditions, it's time to reshape systems in order to put an end to this massive loss of talent. Exposing the harmful repercussions of racist, toxic organizational cultures, soul coach Rha Goddess and corporate inclusion visionary Deepa Purushothaman share four pathways to reimagine work so women of color are centered as leaders. Instead of aspiring to a "seat at the table", they urge us to remake the whole table -- and stop fighting for "one broke-ass chair."

speakerList.name: Rha Goddess
speakerList.bio: Rha Goddess is a cultural innovator, social impact strategist and creative change agent. She works with leaders and organizations to realign their missions in ways that are more purposeful, profitable and impactful.

speakerList.name: Deepa Purushothaman
speakerList.bio: Deepa Purushothaman challenges and redefines the status quo of leadership success and power, centering the needs and experiences of women of color and unveiling inclusion biases in corporate structures.

title: 4 ways to redefine power at work to include women of color
